doc.after: Tripura is a landlocked state in North East India, where the seven contiguous statesÂ â Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland and TripuraÂ â are collectively known as the Seven Sister States. Spread over 10,491.69Â km2 (4,050.86Â sqÂ mi), Tripura is the third-smallest among the 28 states in the country, behind Goa and Sikkim. It extends from 22Â°56'N to 24Â°32'N, and 91Â°09'E to 92Â°20'E.[23]:3 Its maximum extent measures about 184Â km (114Â mi) from north to south, and 113Â km (70Â mi) east to west. Tripura is bordered by the country of Bangladesh to the west, north and south; and the Indian states of Assam to the north east; and Mizoram to the east.[23]:3 It is accessible by national highways passing through the Karimganj district of Assam and Mamit district of Mizoram.[31]
